availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John L. Morrison (La Salle County, Illinois, farmer and soldier)

body.p: La Salle County, Illinois, farmer and soldier. Native of Scotland. Married to Elizabeth Morrison. Father of Mary Morrison, George Morrison, Lyall Morrison, and Fox Morrison. Farmer in La Salle County, Illinois, in 1860. Served in Henshaw's Independent Battery Light Artillery (U.S.A.) as a sergeant and second lieutenant from September 9, 1862 to July 18, 1865. Resident of La Salle County in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Illinois, La Salle County, Bruce, p. 610.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Illinois, La Salle County, Ottawa, p. 584A.
Illinois State Census, (1865), Illinois, La Salle County, Ottawa, p. 231.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Illinois, vol. 9, 1861-1866 (Springfield, IL: H. W. Rokker, 1886), 763.
